comment: Dr. Riehm is just that- a DOCTOR. Do not take her class if you do not want to work. You have to study for your test and you have to do your article assignments. This is college people, you have to work for your degree. She's understanding and willing to help you.

Dr.Riehm is very knowledgeable about history and beyond passionate about her area of study. She had tons of stories to tell and uses power points every day. There is reading due EVERY SINGLE CLASS. There are 4 tests- handwritten, multiple choice and essay.If you don't want to work don't take her.

This was the worst class i have taken in college so far. Dr Reihm is mean and her class is a joke. She goes over all this useless material and then makes her tests format similar to that of a 3rd grade history test. If you have any other options other then her then take it. DO NOT TAKE HER! Way too old to be teaching

She loves chronology for quizzes and tests, though she won't emphasize it much during lecture. For tests she would only tell us to use the powerpoints as a study guide. If you knew the study guide material you could do well. She expects well written essays and will take off for what seem like small errors. She expects class participation.

Her test questions were easy if you study her study guide but even if you get all of them right, you WILL still fail the test if you are not a great writer like she is. She will also point out little mistakes. Attendence is mandatory, but it wont helpyou get a better grade. She hates when you show up late, but she did it more than once.

Dr. Riehm is... well she's just difficult. Must be nice to have that PhD- unless you want one, wouldn't take her. I missed ONE grade and already, can't pass the class with even a C- it wasn't even a test I missed. Withdrawing for my own good. Next semester there will be more options of prof.

If you are just taking this as a core requirement, than this is not the right professor for you. She is hard and straight forward. She gives no extra credits and no bonus points for anything in that class. She is into her work. A lot of reading for homework.
Dr. Riehm is an amazing teacher. She is so passionate about history that it rubs off on you. Her class is a tad difficult, but she doesn't throw any curve balls. Take her if you really want to learn.

Very Good Professor. Took her for Post Reconstruction American History. If no work is your goal don't take her. She will lecture and test on related topics. And you will have to read the book on your own as she assigns it. That said she provides pretest outlines that if you study off them will get you a "B"... if you do the reading you will get A
